facts.text: A 2020 Stanford study found that remote workers were 13% more productive than their office counterparts, primarily due to fewer breaks and sick days.
Microsoft's 2021 Work Trend Index found that 54% of employees felt overworked and 39% felt exhausted when working remotely.
The IPCC's Sixth Assessment Report (2021) concluded with 95% confidence that human activities are the primary cause of global warming since the 1950s.
Global CO2 emissions reached a record high of 36.8 billion metric tons in 2022, with fossil fuel combustion accounting for over 75% of total emissions.
Electric vehicles produce 50-70% fewer lifecycle emissions than gasoline cars, even when accounting for battery production and electricity generation.
A 2023 study found that AI systems like GPT-4 can pass the bar exam with a score in the 90th percentile, compared to GPT-3.5's 10th percentile.
The US federal minimum wage has been $7.25 per hour since 2009, representing a 29% decrease in purchasing power due to inflation.
A 2022 CBO report estimated that raising the federal minimum wage to $15 by 2025 would lift 900,000 people out of poverty but eliminate 1.4 million jobs.
Nuclear energy generates electricity with near-zero carbon emissions and has the lowest death rate per unit of energy produced among all major energy sources.
The average construction cost of new nuclear power plants in the US is $6,000-9,000 per kilowatt, significantly higher than solar ($1,000/kW) or wind ($1,300/kW).
In 2022, renewable energy sources (solar, wind, hydro) accounted for 29% of global electricity generation, up from 19% in 2011.
The average American spends 51 minutes per day driving, with commuters in major cities spending up to 2 hours daily in their vehicles.
Public transportation produces 76% less greenhouse gas emissions per passenger mile than private vehicles, according to APTA.
New York City has the lowest vehicle ownership rate among major US cities, with only 45% of households owning a car.
The median rent for a one-bedroom apartment in Manhattan was $4,175 in 2023, making it the most expensive rental market in the United States.
Studies show that intermittent fasting can improve insulin sensitivity, reduce inflammation, and may extend lifespan in animal models.
The human brain uses approximately 20% of the body's total energy despite representing only 2% of body weight.
According to Nielsen, the average American watches 3 hours and 10 minutes of television per day, with adults 65+ watching over 4 hours daily.
A 2022 meta-analysis found that meditation practice can reduce anxiety by 60% and depression by 53% on average.
The global cryptocurrency market capitalization peaked at $2.9 trillion in November 2021 before falling to around $1.1 trillion by late 2022.
Bitcoin mining consumes approximately 150 terawatt-hours of electricity annually, comparable to the entire country of Argentina.
The S&P 500 has historically returned an average of 10% per year since its inception in 1926, adjusted for inflation the average is around 7%.
Studies show that 80-90% of active fund managers fail to beat their benchmark index over a 10-year period after accounting for fees.
According to UNESCO, 773 million adults worldwide lack basic literacy skills, with two-thirds being women.
The average student loan debt for US college graduates in 2023 was $37,787, with total student debt exceeding $1.7 trillion.
facts.source: Federal Reserve Bank of New York
